title: Ticket #1782: Report number of DAG nodes to dagman.out and classad
description: After DAGMan finishes parsing the DAG file(s), it should report the total number of nodes in the dagman.out file, and also put that value into its own classad. (Suggested during today's LIGO phone conference.)
remarks:
Updated priority to match Todd's new scheme (1=fire, 2=soon, 3=time permitting, 4=not yet prioritized, 5=wishlist/ideas).

2012-Mar-09 08:58:46 by nwp:
This feature seems useless if #2616 is implemented.

2012-Dec-20 14:27:45 by wenger:
Would it also be useful to have some extra info in the classad, like the number of nodes in the queue, not ready, etc.?

2012-Dec-20 14:46:37 by wenger:
This is already in the dagman.out file. There is a line like this: 

  Dag contains <n> total jobs

So it's just a matter of adding the info to the classad.

2013-Mar-05 10:07:42 by pfc:
Yes, adding this to the classad, along with the state of the DAG's execution (the number of nodes in the queue, not ready, etc) would be really useful.

2013-Mar-06 16:01:48 by wenger:
How about attribute names like this:
  • DAGNodesTotal
  • DAGNodesDone
  • DAGNodesPrerun
  • DAGNodesQueued
  • DAGNodesPostrun
  • DAGNodesReady
  • DAGNodesUnready
  • DAGNodesFailed

2013-Mar-06 16:32:25 by wenger:
I just talked with Greg Thain about how DAGMan can actually edit its own classad. He said basically do condor_qedit, or do what condor_qedit does under the hood.

He also asked an interesting question: does DAGMan know whether it's a scheduler universe job? In other words, what happens if you directly run condor_dagman from the command line? I know that used to work, but I wonder what DAGMan gets as its job id in that case.

I'm thinking that I want to create a dagman_classadd.cpp/h to handle all of the classad-related stuff...

2013-Mar-06 16:40:08 by wenger:
I'm also thinking that once I get this working I should see how long it takes to update the classad, and have a way to disable the updating if it's not real fast.

2013-Mar-07 16:00:44 by wenger:
Working on this on V7_9-gittrac_1782-branch.

2013-Mar-21 17:31:17 by wenger:
I think this is all done, so I'm going to assign it to Nathan to review.

2013-Mar-22 09:06:35 by nwp:
It looks like this patch will disable running condor_dagman from the command line, something I have found useful for debugging. condor_dagman won't be assigned a jobid, and then it will barf if strictness is sufficiently high.

2013-Mar-22 09:11:09 by nwp:
You do not check that _dagmanClassad is not null before calling Update.

2013-Mar-22 10:15:09 by wenger:
Okay, I'll add a check for _dagmanClassad being NULL. As far as running from the command line, this should only fail if you have the strictness level set to 3 (the highest level). I guess I could get rid of the strictness level check, since if you're running from the command line you clearly don't expect to get anything updated in a classad. Anything else?

2013-Mar-22 11:13:49 by nwp:
No, I think everything else looks fine.

2013-Mar-22 13:43:33 by wenger:
Okay, I'll go ahead and merge unless you want to check the latest changes. (BTW, I did test running DAGMan on the command line, and it worked okay -- as long as you have all the right arguments and environment.)

2013-Mar-22 14:29:14 by nwp:
Looks fine to me. go ahead and merge.

2013-Mar-22 15:52:36 by wenger:
This is now merged to V7_9_5-branch. I'll resolve the ticket as soon as I see that the builds are all okay.
